snippet: Six weeks into the rollout of the health care law, some of the online insurance exchanges run by states are confronting serious issues that mirror those of the larger federal exchange.
abstract: Some online insurance exchanges run by states are continuing to have serious technological problems six weeks into rollout of Affordable Care Act, often mirroring issues plaguing much larger federal exchanges.

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and REED ABELSON

lead_paragraph: Six weeks into the rollout of the health care law, some of the online insurance exchanges run by states are confronting serious issues that mirror those of the larger federal exchange.

headline.main: Some State Insurance Exchanges Continue to Battle Technical Problems
headline.print_headline: Some State Insurance Exchanges Continue to Battle Technical Problems

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
